method.name: BNGE

reference.ref: Dietrich Wettschereck, Thomas G. Dietterich, An Experimental Comparison of the Nearest-Neighbor and Nearest-Hyperrectangle Algorithms, Machine Learning, 19, 5-27 (1995)

generalDescription.type: Classification model combining rule induction and instance-based learning.
generalDescription.objective: The algorithm tries to show that is enough to consider a small neighbourhood to achieve classification accuracy comparable to an algorithm considering the whole learning set, combining this k-nearest neighbours method and a rule-based algorithm.
generalDescription.howWork:
BNGE considers all training instances as hyperectangles, and tries to growth them by randomly merging the nearest rectangles of one class. The merge is performed only if the resulting hyperectangle does not overlap with any other.
When no more merges can be done, the set of hyperrectangles obtained is employed to perform the classification process.

parameterSpec.param: Seed: Initial seed of the random number generator.
